body:
Comment 1: 
There's a fundamental difference between
local communication and remote communication:
the latter has many more failure modes.
When you send a message locally, you know
it's not going to get lost or reordered and
you know that the receiver is on the same side.

We have a different mechanism that exposes
these kinds of failure modes, because applications
need to be able to respond to them appropriately.
See http://golang.org/pkg/rpc/ and http://golang.org/pkg/gob/
